snippet: Drivers piled up behind bridge checkpoints, and riders waited for shuttle buses, sometimes for hours, on the way into Manhattan.
abstract: New York City's mass transit system is slowly being restored after Hurricane Sandy forced a full-scale shutdown, but it will be some time before subways, buses and suburban train lines, along with roads, bridges and tunnels serving them, are all fully operational again.
lead_paragraph: Drivers piled up behind bridge checkpoints, and riders waited for shuttle buses, sometimes for hours, on the way into Manhattan.

headline.seo: Long Lines Plague Commuters as Transit System Slowly Recuperates
headline.main: Long Lines Plague Commuters as a Transit System Slowly Recuperates
headline.print_headline: Long Lines Plague Commuters as a Transit System Slowly Recuperates
